marketNews.title: Important Developments During the Eid al-Fitr Holiday
marketNews.content: During the 2024 Eid al-Fitr holiday period, several developments need attention from investors: 1. US Inflation Rebounds Beyond Expectations - The US recorded inflation of 3.5% YoY in March 2024 (vs. February 2024: inflation 3.2%), exceeding consensus expectations at 3.4%. This figure marks the third consecutive month of US inflation data coming higher than expected since January 2024, thereby strengthening the narrative of higher for longer rates. Based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool, the market currently expects the Fed will only start cutting interest rates in 3Q24, later than previous expectations which projected rate cuts would begin in June 2024. Here are some implications of the US inflation development as of Tuesday (16/4): - The yield on the 10-year US government bond continued to climb from the level of ~4.2% at the end of March 2024 to ~4.6%. - The US Dollar Index (DXY) rose from the 104 level at the end of March 2024 to the range of 106. - The S&P 500 stock index fell -3.7% MTD. - For Indonesia, the negative impact is already visible in the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar, which weakened further from the level of 15,880 at the end of March 2024 to 16,176. 2. Increasing Geopolitical Tensions - On April 13, 2024, Iran launched an attack on Israel. This conflict escalation is further pushing up the prices of several commodities, such as crude oil, gold, and silver. 3. Rising Commodity Prices due to Supply Issues and/or Better Demand Outlook - Besides the geopolitical tension factor, numerous commodities also experienced price strengthening due to supply problems and a better demand outlook. - Crude Oil: Driven by expectations of a world oil deficit in 2024 alongside low supply due to OPEC+ production cuts and a higher-than-initially-forecasted demand outlook due to stronger-than-expected US and China economic data. - Tin: Driven by low supply due to uncertainty regarding Indonesian and Myanmar exports, better manufacturing activity in the US and China, and the prohibition of Russian metal mine production from being traded on the London Metal Exchange. - Copper: Potential for a supply shortage due to the closure of one of the worldâ€™s largest copper mines, The Cobre, located in Panama. Furthermore, price strengthening is also driven by the potential increase in copper demand for energy transition purposes. - Nickel: The US and UK governments issued trade ban sanctions against Russian commodities, namely nickel, copper, and aluminum. This impacted the increased volatility in the price movements of these commodities. - Pulp: Supply disruption from producers in Finland due to demonstrations at Finnish ports since the beginning of March 2024.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: A series of negative sentiments above caused the IHSG to weaken by -1.68% on Tuesday (16/4), with interest rate-sensitive sectors - such as property (-3.25%), technology (-2.85%), and finance (-2.49%) - experiencing significant declines. However, we assess that this correction could be an opportunity for investors to buy banking stocks with more attractive valuations, because in our opinion the fundamentals and prospects are still good. Meanwhile, the rising trend in commodity prices and the strengthening of the US dollar potentially bring positive impacts for the commodity issuers above.

marketNews.title: China's GDP Growth in 1Q24 Surpassed Expectations
marketNews.content: China's Gross Domestic Product was recorded to grow +5.3% YoY and +1.6% QoQ in 1Q24 (vs. 4Q23: +5.2% YoY, +1% QoQ), surpassing consensus expectations at +4.6% YoY and +1.4% QoQ.

marketNews.title: US and UK Ban Russian Nickel Trading
marketNews.content: The UK and US governments banned the trading of Russian-origin nickel on the London Metal Exchange and Chicago Mercantile Exchange. This sanction is effective for nickel produced after April 13, 2024, and is intended to reduce Russia's export revenue amidst the war in Ukraine which has been ongoing since 2022. Russia contributes 6% to global refined nickel production.

marketNews.title: China's Coal Imports Surged in 1Q24
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm, Kpler, noted that China imported 97.43 million tons of coal (+16.9% YoY) in 1Q24. This surge occurred amid consensus expectations projecting China's coal imports in 2024 to be flat at around 450-500 million tons (vs. 2023 realization: 474.42 million tons).

tickerNews.title: ADRO Plans Stock Buyback of IDR 4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia plans a stock buyback with a maximum fund of 4 trillion rupiah. The maximum number and price of the buyback have not yet been announced. This corporate action will take place for 12 months starting from May 16, 2024. This plan will be discussed at the GMS on May 15, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Subsidiary Secures USD 490 Million Loan Facility
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials through its subsidiary, PT ESG New Energy Material, obtained a loan facility of 490 million US dollars from Bangkok Bank Public Company Limited, Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI). The facility is intended for financing the construction of an HPAL smelter and the equity participation in a feed preparation plant company.

tickerNews.title: WINS Secured USD 75 Million in Contracts by February 2024 and Prepares New Vessels
tickerNews.content: Investor Relations Wintermar Offshore Marine, Pek Swan Layanto, stated that the company secured contracts amounting to 75 million US dollars during 2M24. Pek Swan also mentioned that WINS has secured contracts from India, Brunei Darussalam, and Thailand with more favorable charter rates. WINS is preparing 2 Platform Supply Vessel units scheduled to commence operations in 2H24.

tickerNews.title: AVIA Plans to Open 8-9 New Distribution Centers in 2024
tickerNews.content: Head of Investor Relations Avia Avian, Andreas Timothy Hadikrisno, stated that the company plans to open 8-9 new distribution center points in 2024, with a cost of 2 billion rupiah per unit. This Capex is separate from the 450 billion rupiah capital expenditure allocated by AVIA to continue the construction of a paint factory in Cirebon, West Java. As of the end of 2023, AVIA had 118 of its own distribution centers, 14 mini distribution centers, and 40 third-party distribution centers. AVIA targets having 140 distribution centers by 2026.

tickerNews.title: AKRA Controlling Shareholder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 2 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,733 rupiah per share on April 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from 60.98% to 60.99%.

tickerNews.title: Automotive Sales Figures for Indonesia in March 2024 and 1Q24
tickerNews.content: Gaikindo noted that car wholesale sales in Indonesia in March 2024 amounted to 74,724 units (+5.8% MoM, -26.2% YoY). During 3M24, car wholesale sales only reached 214,997 units (-23.9% YoY), equivalent to 19.5% of the 2024 target of 1.1 million units. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) noted that domestic motorcycle sales in Indonesia in March 2024 were 583,747 units (+4.5% MoM, -7.8% YoY). During 3M24, domestic motorcycle sales were 1.74 million units (-4.9% YoY), equivalent to 26.7-28% of the 2024 target of 6.2-6.5 million units.
